intro: Arachnothryx reflexa var. meridensis, commonly known as the northern arachnothryx, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elliptical, winged fruits. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
